antiPatterns.name: Bottleneck Service
antiPatterns.description: A service that is being used by too many consumers and therefore becomes a bottleneck and single point of failure.
antiPatterns.consequences: The service may have increased response times and low availability. It also becomes a single point of failure in the architecture.
antiPatterns.cause: Functionality may gradually become more and more important and is therefore used by more and more consumers, maybe even external ones via a public service interface. To maximize reuse, service interfaces are sometimes also generalized which leads to more service consumers as well.
